text: hi everyone anthony fantano here the
internet's busiest music nerd and it's
time for a review of this new worm rot
album hiss this is the newest
full-length lp from legendary singapore
grind core outfit worm rot subjecting
fans to the longest gap between albums
they ever have before six whole years as
their last lp voices dropped in 2016
which was an interesting record for the
band where they showed up with a bit
more versatility to offer than the
blistering durge in 2011 and over a
decade down the road since they started
worm rot is sounding on this new record
here still ferocious as hell and more
ambitious than ever of course on this
thing we have tons of speed freak blast
beats hideous vile screams chunky gnarly
guitars all operating at breakneck
speeds when it comes to intensity within
grindcore wormrot truly does hang with
the best of the best but intensity is
really just one piece of the puzzle for
a quality grindcore record it can also
be a blessing and a curse because the
thing that sort of makes the genre the
genre also could potentially prevent
your songs from really being all that
memorable especially if you're not
coming through with sticky and
compelling vocal drum and guitar parts
which wormrot does handily here but
their drive pushes them even far beyond
that with a load of sharp thrash and
crossover thrash riffs that are so good
they're liable to make any mosh pit a
little too dangerous like with the track
behind closed doors plus on the track
when talking fails it's time for
violence uh sees these very same riffs
teaming up with some great gang vocals
too so of course yeah tracks like this
bring some really brutal moments to the
table but there's also quite a few
hellish and also harmonious moments on
this project where the band manages to
work some black metal nuances into the
fold with either some lead lines or
chord progressions like on hatred
transcending as well as the track
desolate landscapes at a few points on
this thing there is even violin like on
the song grieve as well as one of my
favorite songs here weeping willow where
the violin colors the back end of the
song really nicely with this very
dissonant and kind of psychedelic solo
passage so it's pretty clear listening
through this project worm rock doesn't
just want to hit listeners with a
dizzying firestorm of noise they
actually do come through with some
memorable riffs and melodies and ideas
but also a decent amount of variety too
like with a few shorter cuts such as the
10 second unrecognizable and the 19
second shattered faith which are
throttling and relentless and pretty
much standard for the grindcore genre
for songs this short to be sounding like
this it's actually the longer spots on
this lp that i found to be the most
impressive like the opening track the
darkest burden which brings this record
from 0 to 100 after about 30 seconds of
silence and i love on this track that
not only are the riffs gnarly as hell
but some of the harmonious chords
playing underneath them bring a richness
that you don't usually hear in a
grindcore track this is even more so the
case for the four minute closer on this
lp which is the longest track here by
quite a bit but i think wormrot truly
does make this trip worth it with more
black metal influences coming through on
the chord progression side some
disorienting switch ups and changes to
come from there and then we eventually
get this very dramatic almost
screamo-esque outro section of the song
that is topped with a very epic violin
solo like black metal grindcore and
screamo
all assembling on the same song and
making for kind of an emotional climax
for this record with the violin what is
happening and then from there the whole
record ends like it starts in silence
there are other long cuts on this lp
that bring some impressive performances
too be a voiceless choir desolate
landscapes that i mentioned earlier also
seizures which i think is the
most just balls to the [ __ ] wall song
on this entire lp and that's saying
something considering how fast and
violent pretty much every song here is
there's also hatred transcending whose
entire last leg sounds like the track is
being swallowed into a portal leading
right to hell the only longer cut on
here i wasn't too crazy about has to be
sea of disease which is led by these
very slow and heavy rifts that are a bit
moody and dramatic and it's it's a cool
tension builder but eventually the grind
core passages that are broken into does
so much feel like they are lifting off
of
these kind of dark guitar passages prior
it's it's more like a detour that kind
of kills what has been pulled together
up until this point still i do
appreciate the band making the effort to
switch things up we also get some
frightening transitional moments on the
21 tracks here like pale moonlight which
is this a really cool drum and vocal
passage that's a quite freaky all will
wither is a similar vibe but with a
creepier more whispered style vocals we
also get cool little details on these
tracks like the cultish atmosphere clean
lead vocals on the cut broken maze which
don't necessarily blow me away i think
they could have been performed better
but they still do stand out as a unique
moment on this lp the stuttering and
glitchy guitar bits on the song vicious
circle are a nice touch too but with all
that being said there are at least a
handful of cuts on this thing that do
come off a bit samey or don't add that
much to the track list especially toward
the end of the album where it feels like
the band despite their best efforts are
painting themselves into a corner at
least a little bit be it with the track
spiral eyes or noxious cloud which yes
don't stick with me but i wouldn't
necessarily call these tracks like a
speed bump in the road or anything like
that i mean in their own way they still
do add to the uh a very harrowing
experience of this 33-minute album
overall but yeah i mean all in all i
think this is a great grindcore album
what else can i say the production is
really punchy and clear and killer the
drumming is fantastic the vocals and the
genre fusions are certainly pushing
things in a refreshing direction are
there moments where i feel like they
could have pushed further yes but for
the most part they are doing their thing
and doing it well and damn if this thing
isn't one of the best records in this
genre for this year and considering the
quality level that worm rot typically
operates at uh this is most likely going
to be one of the best records in the
genre for a while feeling a light eight
on this lp tran position have you given
this album a listen did you love it did
you hate it what would you rate it
you're the best you're the best what
should i review next hit the like if you
like please subscribe and please don't
cry hit the bell as well over here next
to my head is another video that you can
check out hit that up or the link to
subscribe to the channel anthony fantano
worm rot
forever
